newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times business - Oct 7.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times business - Oct 7.

text.p: The New York Times reported the following business stories on Monday:

* Microsoft Corp is trying to stop or change planned technical standards for digital television broadcasting by lobbying the U.S. Federal Communications Commission to accommodate the computer software company and its industry allies.
* The Canadian Automobile Workers union is demanding that General Motors Corp agree to a new labor contract that would prevent management from selling factories and transfering jobs abroad.

* The United States has filed a complaint against Canada before the World Trade Organisation, saying the neighboring country's 80-percent excise tax on Canadian editions of U.S. magazines restricts competition.
* Olivetti SpA joins a series of European computer makers that have abandoned the industry in the face of U.S. competition by selling their personal computer divisions.
* New computer software company Marimba Inc is to introduce software that will quicken the distribution of information over the Internet on Monday.
